meanings.definition: Not likely to bring good fortune or happiness; unlucky
meanings.sent1: The black cat crossing my path felt unsonsy.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather made the picnic feel unsonsy.
meanings.sent3: It was unsonsy that every time I wore my lucky socks, I tripped.
meanings.sent4: The unsonsy clouds seemed to follow him wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The unsonsy day started with a broken mirror and ended with a missed bus.

meanings.sent1: The taste of the medicine was unsonsy.
meanings.sent2: The unsonsy smell coming from the garbage can made me hold my nose.
meanings.sent3: The unsonsy sound of nails on a chalkboard always made her cringe.
meanings.sent4: The unsonsy taste of burnt popcorn lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The unsonsy sight of the messy room made her want to clean immediately.

meanings.sent1: The unsonsy child kept running around the restaurant.
meanings.sent2: The unsonsy behavior of the dog caused chaos at the park.
meanings.sent3: It was unsonsy when the cat knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The unsonsy students were always causing disruptions in class.
meanings.sent5: The unsonsy puppy chewed on everything in sight.
